author: Staff Reporter
text:
Thoothukudi Fast Track Mahila Court Judge J. Flora on Tuesday sentenced a man, accused of assaulting a woman panchayat president, to undergo two years of rigorous imprisonment.

According to prosecution, S. Harish Ravi (35) of Keela Street in Nazareth, proprietor of a dyeing unit, was found guilty of causing grievous injuries to Rose Jeyakodi (64), president of Kadayanodai village panchayat on September 14, 2012. Ms. Jeyakodi suffered fracture in her forearm when the accused entered the panchayat office and assaulted her with a wooden log.

The incident occurred after his dyeing unit was closed by the panchayat president, who also prevented him from transporting water by a lorry from a bore well at Kadayanodai to his unit.

Nazareth police filed a case in this connection. Ravi was punished under Section 325 (causing grievous hurt) of the Indian Penal Code. A fine of Rs. 2,000 was also imposed on him.
title: Jail term for assaulting panchayat president
